title-group.article-title: Memory, Hybridity, and Creative Alliance in Haruki Murakami's Fiction

abstract.p: This essay explores the use of animals in Haruki Murakami's fiction, where animals serve as the emblem of selfhood, where human-animal hybrids manifest the fragmented self, and where becoming-animal inspires a creative process in which humans can fare better.
